title: 1D motion - direction of motion from graph

content.question: An object moves in one dimension along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis as described by the position versus time graph shown in the figure. During the time interval of the graph, how many times does the object change direction and what feature or features of the graph justifies this response?

choices.label: One time because the graph indicates that there is a single point where the object’s velocity is zero and its acceleration is zero.
One time because the graph indicates that there is a single point where the object’s velocity is zero and its acceleration is nonzero.
Two times because the graph indicates that the velocity of the object is zero at two different points.
Two times because the graph indicates that the position of the object is zero at two different points.

content.answer: One time because the graph indicates that there is a single point where the object’s velocity is zero and its acceleration is nonzero.
